SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.text

Record Class FragmentedText

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
com.dua3.utility.text.FragmentedText
Record Components:
lines - a list of lines, where each line is represented by a list of Fragment objects
width - the width of the layout area for the text
height - the height of the layout area for the text
baseLine - the baseline value of the line the fragment belongs to
actualWidth - the calculated width of the text after layout
actualHeight - the calculated height of the text after layout
public record FragmentedText(List<List<FragmentedText.Fragment>> lines, float width, float height, float baseLine, float actualWidth, float actualHeight) extends Record
Represents a fragmented text that can be rendered within a specified bounding rectangle.

The FragmentedText class holds a list of lines, where each line is represented by a list of FragmentedText.Fragment objects. Fragments are text segments that cannot be split and have uniform font attributes. The text is split based on whitespace characters and text decorations (font, text decoration). The class also stores the dimensions and position of the text within the bounding rectangle.

    Class
    Description
    static final record 
    FragmentedText.Fragment
    A text fragment that can't be split (i.e., contains no whitespace) and has a uniform font so that it can be drawn in a single operation.

    • generateFragments

      public static FragmentedText generateFragments(RichText text, FontUtil fontUtil, Font font, float width, float height, Alignment hAlign, VerticalAlignment vAlign, Graphics.HAnchor hAnchor, Graphics.VAnchor vAnchor, float wrapWidth)
      Split text into fragments and layout according to alignment settings.

      Split the text into fragments that are either whitespace or free of whitespace and have uniform text attributes (font, text decoration). For each line, a list of such fragments is generated and added to the list of fragment lines (see lines()).

      The layout algorithm

      • For each line of text, automatic wrapping is applied when the line width exceeds width.
      • The fragments of each line are horizontally distributed according to the hAlign parameter.
      • The lines of fragments are then distributed vertically according to vAlign and height. If the given height is smaller than the required height, the text overflows.
      • The anchor is applied so that when the text is rendered, it is displayed according to the anchor setting.
      Parameters:
      text - the text
      fontUtil - the FontUtil to use for generating fonts
      font - the default Font
      width - the height of the output area; used for horizontal alignment
      height - the height of the output area; used for vertical alignment
      hAlign - the horizontal alignment setting
      vAlign - the vertical alignment setting
      hAnchor - the horizontal anchor setting
      vAnchor - the vertical anchor setting
      wrapWidth - the width at which to apply wrapping; pass NO_WRAP to disable wrapping
      Returns:
      the fragmented text as a FragmentedText instance

    • getTextRec

      public Rectangle2f getTextRec()
      Retrieves the rectangle that bounds the text based on its position and actual dimensions.

      This method calculates the bounding rectangle by determining the smallest x-coordinate, y-coordinate, and incorporating the actual width and height of the text. If no lines of text are present, it returns a rectangle with all dimensions set to zero.

      Returns:
      a Rectangle2f object representing the bounding box of the text.
